intro: Oenothera fraseri, commonly known as the Fraser's evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its showy, yellow to orange flowers that open in the evening and close by morning. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often reddish in color. Oenothera fraseri is part of the evening primrose family (Onagraceae) and is known for its nocturnal blooming pattern.
